channel.title: Gear on Late News
channel.description: Recent content in Gear on Late News

item.title: Honor’s New AI Agent Can Read and Understand Your Screen
item.description: The Honor UI Agent—powered by Google’s Gemini 2 model—gives a glimpse of artificial intelligence agents on Android.

item.title: The Humane Ai Pin Has Already Been Brought Back to Life
item.description: Humane bricked its pricey gadget on Friday afternoon. A short time later, a hacker got the codes to unlock it and potentially turn it into the true smartphone replacement it was meant to be.

item.title: What to Do With Your Defunct Humane Ai Pin
item.description: Humane Ai’s Pins stopped working today, turning the year-old wearable into a paperweight. Here are some ideas for what to do with yours if you want to avoid e-waste.

item.title: OpenAI Launches GPT-4.5 for ChatGPT—It’s Huge and Compute-Intensive
item.description: Internally called Orion, GPT-4.5 is OpenAI’s largest model to date, and it’s first available through the company’s $200 monthly ChatGPT subscription.

item.title: Amazon's Souped-Up Alexa+ Arrives Next Month
item.description: Alexa+ will cost $20 a month but will be free for Amazon Prime members. It’ll eventually arrive on nearly every Alexa device the company has shipped.

item.title: Your Boss Wants You Back in the Office. This Surveillance Tech Could Be Waiting for You
item.description: Warehouse-style employee tracking tech has expanded into job after job. Now, as millions are called back to the workplace, it’s finally coming for the American office worker.
